name: Hasselback Air Fryer Potatoes
author: Bren
summary: Air-fried hasselback potatoes are so easy yet they make such a pretty presentation. I serve these with a simple garlic aioli, but feel free to add a dollop of sour cream or topping of your choice.
ingredients: 4 (6 ounce) russet potatoes, scrubbed and dried
4 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
Cut a very thin slice lengthwise from the flattest side of 1 potato
Lay potato on a cutting board, cut-side down so it lays evenly without rolling
Place chopsticks lengthwise along top and bottom edges of potato
Slice evenly across entire length of potato to make 1/4-inch slices, making sure the knife comes to rest on chopsticks each time, keeping the bottom of the potato intact
Brush the outsides and between the slices with oil
Place potatoes into the bowl of the air fryer and cook for 15 minutes
Brush with oil and cook until crispy on the edges and tender in the middles, about 15 minutes more
